translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Flower Birth Stories
The Elder Taraṇiya
“The Fortunate One, the Visionary of the True Goal,
the Leader of Men, the Best of Men,
Having gone in front of the disciples,
went to the bank of the Gaṅgā.
The Gaṅgā was full to the brim, and unfordable,
and I crossed over the Community of monks,
and the Awakened One, the Best of Men.
For eighteen hundred eons
I did not know of any bad destination,
this was the result of my crossing over.
For thirteen hundred eons🔽I was a King who had attained the (Seven) Treasures,
endowed with the (Seven) Treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
And in my last existence,
I was reborn in a Brahmin family,
and together with three friends,
I went forth in the Teacher’s Dispensation.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Teacher’s work.”🔽Thus the Elder Taraṇiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā taraṇiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Taraṇiyattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā taraṇiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽taraṇiya therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Elder Taraṇiya’s Birth Story, the fourth.
